revised_title: The Protective Effects of the Black Rete Mucosum in Negro Skin Against Sunburn
tldr: The author, Sir Everard Home, investigates the protective effects of the black rete mucosum in the skin of negroes and the black pigment at the bottom of the eyes in certain animals. He concludes that these black surfaces can prevent sunburn by converting the sun's radiant matter into sensible heat, thus protecting the skin from scorching.
